txt.en: 'I wish to speak with you about Fangorn, [placeholder]. I have great faith in your good sense, and I am relying heavily upon it now. I believe your deeds can do much to affect change here in these troubled times.'

'Does that satisfy your curiosity about the fate of the young hobbits? They are in good hands now, safe as can be. I am deeply relieved that they came to no harm.\n\n'As for you... will you stay here and do what deeds you can? The forest may never be the same, but I believe your actions will change it for the better.'
'We do not have much time, but I think you will want to hear my tale. Will you not stay for a spell, [placeholder]?'
Gandalf the White wishes to speak with you about the current state of Fangorn, and the role that you might have in stirring the air at last.
Gandalf is on Treebeard's Hill in Fangorn.\n\nYou should speak with Gandalf.
Talk to Gandalf upon Treebeard's Hill
Gandalf is on Treebeard's Hill in Fangorn.\n\nYou should speak with Gandalf.
